alert.note: Alert for Middle Rio Grande Valley (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Fire Weather Watch issued April 13 at 7:47PM MDT until April 14 at 8:00PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM NOON TO 8 PM MDT FRIDAY FOR MUCH OF EASTERN NEW MEXICO DUE TO STRONG WINDS, LOW HUMIDITY AND AN UNSTABLE ATMOSPHERE... ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM FRIDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH FRIDAY EVENING FOR THE MIDDLE RIO GRANDE VALLEY DUE TO STRONG WINDS, LOW HUMIDITY AND AN UNSTABLE ATMOSPHERE... .Winds are beginning to decrease in speed, and as temperatures cool through the evening the humidity will rise, causing critical fire weather conditions to come to an end. However, another round of critical fire weather conditions is expected to return on Friday across much of eastern New Mexico and potentially into central portions of the state as well. Winds will re-strengthen through the late morning and early afternoon Friday with another round of low humidity. ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM FRIDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH FRIDAY EVENING... ...RED FLAG WARNING WILL EXPIRE AT 8 PM MDT THIS EVENING... * AREA AND TIMING...Middle Rio Grande Valley (Zone 106) from noon to 8 pm MDT Friday. * 20 FOOT WINDS...West southwest 20 to 25 mph with gusts near 35 mph on Friday. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...Ranging from 10 to 16 percent Friday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended.
info.instruction: Please advise the appropriate officials or fire crews in the field of this Fire Weather Watch.
